news_header: World leaders congratulated Donald Trump on his victory in the US presidential election, expressing hopes for future collaboration and stability.
news_text: Following Donald Trump's victory in the US presidential election, various world leaders extended their congratulations. Leaders like India's Narendra Modi and Hungary's Viktor Orban praised Trump's return to power, while others, including European Commission President Ursula von der Leyen, expressed hopes for constructive collaboration. Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy acknowledged Trump's commitment to global peace, while Russian officials remained cautious. Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu and Qatari Emir Sheikh Tamim bin Hamad Al-Thani also congratulated Trump, emphasizing the importance of US involvement in regional stability. European leaders highlighted the need for cooperation, with German Chancellor Olaf Scholz and French President Emmanuel Macron expressing readiness to work together. Leaders from Africa, including Nigeria's Bola Tinubu, anticipated beneficial partnerships with the US under Trump's leadership.
